headline: Is Baker Hughes’ Data Center Turbine Deal With Twenty20 Energy Reshaping the Investment Case for BKR?
summary: Baker Hughes recently announced it received an order from Twenty20 Energy for 10 Frame 5 gas turbines and related generator technology, supporting up to 250 MW of power for data center projects in Georgia and Texas, with initial deliveries planned for 2027. This deal, alongside plans for a broader multi-gigawatt supply agreement, underscores how Baker Hughes is tying its gas turbine franchise to the power needs of AI and digital infrastructure across the United States. Next, we’ll examine...
